revised_title: Exploring the Metric and Curvature Properties of H-Space
tldr: The authors study the space of asymptotically shear-free cuts of an asymptotically flat space-time, known as H-space, and explore its connection with twistor theory. They find that H-space is a 4-dimensional complex manifold with a complex Riemannian metric and demonstrate that its curvature is always self-dual. This research provides an alternative approach to understanding the asymptotic structure of space-time and has implications for the study of gravitational radiation and the geometry of space-time.
